JobFullDesc: Our mission at Microsoft is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more.  And an important element of attaining this mission begins with supporting the development and growth of entrepreneurs and Startups that may become the tech Unicorns of tomorrow.  At Microsoft for Startups, we are grounded in both the world in which we live and the future we strive to create, which is why nurturing a healthy and diverse ecosystem throughout the entire Startup journey is critical.   The Global Partnerships team within Microsoft for Startups is accountable for pushing the envelope on how to further accelerate Startups throughout their journey.  We work with VCs, Accelerators, Corporations, Industry groups, Field teams, Governments and internal stakeholders to assemble world-class Partner-driven programs to support the building of innovative, inspiring new products and businesses.  This is a unique opportunity for a customer-oriented thinker to execute nurture, and enablement motions to accelerate the outcomes of select Startups in program. And as the Sr Manager of Startup Development this role will in turn amplify those success stories through the significant publicity and awareness they drive to support the broader vision of the Microsoft for Startups program. ResponsibilitiesCore competencies include: client service, resilience, goal orientation, business networking ability, structured thinking, and deep project management.  Nurture and engage with early through late stage Startups to grow and accelerate their business outcomes through strategic alignment of internal and external partner resources that address short and long-term goals.  Support Startups and Partner relationships in support of the business vision, mission, strategy, and priorities across all Microsoft for Startups teams.  Deliver significant publicity, energy and attention to the program through Partner-supported Startup outcomes. QualificationsRequired Qualifications: 5+ years of experience working in complex environments from a business development, partner channel development, consulting and/or marketing perspective. Bachelors degree.  Preferred Qualifications: Ability to excel in a fast-paced startup-like environment with flexibility to embrace change and thrive amid ambiguity.  Ability to influence and drive results in complex and highly ambiguous technical and business environment, including ability to communicate and influence from all levels from senior executives on down and across multiple functions and teams.Ability to spot issues in complex technical and business problems.  Education: MBA or post-graduate degree preferred.  Location - anywhere in the US with committed ability to travel at least 20% if based in Seattle or Silicon Valley, and up to 40% if elsewhere in the United States.  Strong partner relationship management communication skills are critical.  Understanding the industry, business, and/or technology trends and competitor strategies to make effective decisions on Startup engagement.    Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.  We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form. Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.
